New Records: Albania scored the fastest goal in Euros history against Italy after only 23 seconds.
Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored the only goal of the match in the 13th minute.
David Raya made a fine save from Kristjan Asllani's powerful 25-yard strike.
David Raya kept out Armando Broja's shot on the turn.
Pre-Game Insights: Spain had already secured top spot in Group B thanks to wins over Croatia and Italy.
Coach Luis de la Fuente made 10 changes to Spain's starting line-up.
Post-Match Reflections: Spain maintained their 100% record at Euro 2024 and eliminated Albania.
Albania finished bottom of Group B and were eliminated from the tournament.
Spain will play their last-16 tie on Sunday in Cologne against a third-placed finisher from one of Group A, D, E or F.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Spain have won all three of their matches at Euro 2024, scoring five goals and conceding none.
Spain had won all eight of their previous encounters with Albania.
Albania have never played at a World Cup and this was only their second appearance in the European Championship.
